IPDR_Status Object_Allocate (  IPDR_PlatformServices *  PS,
size_t  Size,
void(*)(IPDR_PlatformServices *PS, void *)  Destructor,
void **  Object
) 
 

Allocate a reference counted object with the requested size.

Parameters:
PS handle to a platform services structure
Size size of object in bytes.
Destructor pointer to a function which will be called once the object's reference count reaches zero.
Object pointer to newly created object (output)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00072 {
00073     ObjectHeader *OH;
00074 #ifdef DEBUG_MEMORY
00075     IPDR_Status Status =
00076         Platform_dm_MEMORYALLOCATESIZEWITHHDR(PS, sizeof (ObjectHeader), Size, OH, FileName, LineNum);
00077     if (FAILURE(Status)) {
00078         X_MEMPANICSIZE(sizeof (ObjectHeader) + Size, FileName, LineNum);
00079         return Status;
00080     }
00081 #else
00082     Platform_Check_MEMORYALLOCATESIZEWITHHDR(PS,
00083                                              sizeof (ObjectHeader), Size,
00084                                              OH, {});
00085 #endif
00086 
00087     { /* The following ought to be optimized away by the compiler,
00088          unless the check fails. */
00089         if (offsetof(struct XXhdr, pastHdr) != sizeof (ObjectHeader)) {
00090 #ifdef STD_FILE_OPERATIONS_SUPPORT
00091             fprintf(stderr, "\n*** ObjectHeader size invalid: %u should be %u ***\n",
00092                     sizeof (ObjectHeader), offsetof(struct XXhdr, pastHdr));
00093 #endif
00094             abort();
00095         }
00096     }
00097 
00098     OH = (ObjectHeader*)((char*)OH - sizeof (ObjectHeader));
00099     OH->ReferenceCount = 1;
00100     OH->Destructor = Destructor;
00101     /* It already has the size filled in, so we don't neeed to do this:
00102        ... OH->size = Size;
00103     */
00104 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
00105     OH->eyecatcher = 0xa0a1a2a3;
00106 #endif
00107 
00108     *Object = (void *) ((char *) OH + sizeof(ObjectHeader));
00109     memset(*Object, 0, Size);
00110 
00111 #ifdef TRACE_OBJECTS
00112     fprintf(stderr, "Object_Allocate %p (%.99s)\n", ((char*)OH)-8, Object_What(OH));
00113 #endif
00114 
00115     return IPDR_OK;
00116 }

void *  Object
) 
 

Delete a reference counted object (ignoring the current reference count)

Parameters:
PS handle to a platform services structure
Object object to delete
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00199 {
00200     ObjectHeader *OH;
00201 
00202     if (Object == NULL)
00203         return IPDR_OK;
00204 
00205     OH = (ObjectHeader *) ((char *) Object - sizeof(ObjectHeader));
00206 
00207 #ifdef TRACE_OBJECTS
00208     fprintf(stderr, "Object_Delete %p (%.99s) referenceCount=%d\n", ((char*)OH)-8, Object_What(OH), OH->ReferenceCount);
00209 #endif
00210 
00211 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
00212     if (OH->eyecatcher != 0xa0a1a2a3) {
00213         printf("Object_Delete: %.99s Bad ObjectHeader(%p): %x\n",
00214                Object_What(Object), Object, OH->eyecatcher);
00215         abort();
00216     }
00217     OH->eyecatcher = 0;
00218 #endif
00219 
00220 #ifdef DEBUG_MEMORY
00221     return GenericPlatform_dm_MemoryFreeWithHdr(PS, sizeof (ObjectHeader), OH, FileName, LineNum);
00222 #else

00224 #endif

Increase the reference count of an object by one.

Parameters:
PS handle to a platform services structure
Object object to increase reference count of.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00241 {
00242     ObjectHeader *OH;
00243 
00244     if (Object == NULL)
00245         return IPDR_OK;
00246 
00247     OH = (ObjectHeader *) ((char *) Object - sizeof(ObjectHeader));
00248 
00249 #ifdef TRACE_OBJECTS
00250     fprintf(stderr, "Object_Duplicate %p (%.99s) referenceCount=%d + 1\n", ((char*)OH-8), Object_What(OH), OH->ReferenceCount);
00251 #endif
00252 
00253 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
00254     if (OH->eyecatcher != 0xa0a1a2a3) {
00255         printf("Object_Duplicate: %.99s Bad ObjectHeader(%p): %x\n",
00256                Object_What(Object), Object, OH->eyecatcher);
00257         abort();
00258     }
00259 #endif
00260

00262 
00263     return IPDR_OK;

IPDR_Status Object_Release (  IPDR_PlatformServices *  PS,
void *  Object
) 
 

Decrease the reference count of an object. If the reference count reaches zero the destructor will be called and the memory allocated for the object will be freed.

Parameters:
PS handle to a platform services structure
Object object to release
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00282 {
00283 
00284     ObjectHeader *OH;
00285 
00286     if (Object == NULL)
00287         return IPDR_OK;
00288 
00289     OH = (ObjectHeader *) ((char *) Object - sizeof(ObjectHeader));
00290 
00291 #ifdef TRACE_OBJECTS
00292     fprintf(stderr, "Object_Release %p (%.99s) referenceCount=%d - 1\n", ((char*)OH-8), Object_What(OH), OH->ReferenceCount);
00293 #endif
00294 
00295 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
00296     if (OH->eyecatcher != 0xa0a1a2a3) {
00297         printf("Object_Release: %.99s Bad ObjectHeader(%p): %x\n",
00298                Object_What(Object), Object, OH->eyecatcher);
00299     }
00300 #endif
00301 
00302     --(OH->ReferenceCount);
00303     if (OH->ReferenceCount <= 0) {
00304         if (OH->Destructor != NULL)
00305             OH->Destructor(PS, Object);
00306 #ifdef DEBUG_MEMORY
00307         GenericPlatform_dm_MemoryFreeWithHdr(PS, sizeof (ObjectHeader), OH, FileName, LineNum);
00308 #else
00309         Platform_MemoryFreeWithHdr(PS, sizeof (ObjectHeader), OH);
00310 #endif
00311     }
00312 
00313     return IPDR_OK;
00314 }
